text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Jaguar is a video game console compatible with both cartridges and CD-ROMs (via add-on) released in 1993. Technically the only 64-bit console of its generation, but that was only its graphics accelerators. The GPU itself was 32-bit with its CPU being 16-bit. It could display a resolution of 720x526 in 16 million colors. This would mark Atari's last major home console release. Its library of games remained small as the console itself was not that successful, one of its cult titles is 'Alien vs. Predator'.
